conclusion: Analyze the motion of a charged particle in a magnetic and electric field to find the time taken from origin to point P.

The image shows a coordinate plane with a particle moving from the origin O to point P(3L, L), injected at a 45° angle to the y-axis, entering a uniform magnetic field in the fourth quadrant and a uniform electric field in the first quadrant.
The particle's initial velocity is at a 45° angle to the y-axis, and at point P, the velocity is along the positive x-axis with a magnitude V_0.
In the magnetic field, the particle follows a circular path due to the Lorentz force, with the radius of the circular path being mv_0/qB.
The time taken to complete one orbit in the magnetic field is 2πm/qB.
In the electric field, the particle moves from O to P with velocity V_0, taking time L/V_0.
The total time is the sum of times in both fields: 2πm/qB + L/V_0.
Substitute V_0 = qB/m to find the total time: 2πm^2/q^2B + mL/qB.
Calculate the total time taken using known values.
